Row.Text: The Iroquois are known for having a special bond with nature. They understood that they shared their land with the animals, and how important trees were to their survival. The Tree of Peace in an important symbol in Iroquois tradition and in the historical record of diplomacy between the Iroquois and Westerners. Weapons would be buried under a tree to seal a peace agreement. A tree might even be uprooted to create a cavity for the weapons. The replanted tree on top would become a tree of peace.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Forests can only be grown on Grassland, Plains, and Tundra tiles without resources.
Forests can only be grown on Grassland, Plains, and Tundra tiles. Must not have a Jungle or Resource.
Will grow a Forest on this tile, replacing any Improvement or Feature.
It will improve the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this tile.
